intro: Achillea asiatica, commonly known as Asian yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its flat, composite flower heads that range from white to pinkish in color. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy perennial suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its historical use in traditional medicine is noted for its potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
